org.gearvrf

Class GVRFloatTexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRTexture
        • org.gearvrf.GVRFloatTexture

  • public class GVRFloatTexture
extends GVRTexture
    A specialized texture, for doing computation on the GPU. Loads an array of float pairs into a texture; you can access the individual components of each 'pixel' as the .r and {code .g} swizzles.
    Since:
    1.6.3

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRFloatTexture

        public GVRFloatTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                       int width,
                       int height,
                       float[] data)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a float-point texture.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - Current GVRContext
        width - Texture width, in pixels
        height - Texture height, in pixels
        data - A linear array of float pairs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If width or height is <= 0, or if data is null, or if data.length < height * width * 2
        Since:
        1.6.3

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public boolean update(int width,
                      int height,
                      float[] data)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Copy new data to an existing float-point texture. Creating a new GVRFloatTexture is pretty cheap, but it's still not a totally trivial operation: it does involve some memory management and some GL hardware handshaking. Reusing the texture reduces this overhead (primarily by delaying garbage collection). Do be aware that updating a texture will affect any and all materials (and/or post effects) that use the texture!
        Parameters:
        width - Texture width, in pixels
        height - Texture height, in pixels
        data - A linear array of float pairs.
        Returns:
        true if the update succeeded, and false if it failed. Updating a texture requires that the new data parameter has the exact same width and height and pixel format as the original data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If width or height is <= 0, or if data is null, or if data.length < height * width * 2
